title: Guardian Egyptian Released
content:
I'm a bit surprised that I haven't seen a post around here about it yet (unless I've missed it), but according to Mark Porter [Guardian Egyptian is now available for licensing](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211654/http:/www.markporter.com/notebook/?p=65).

Nothing's changed on [Christian Schwartz's](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211654/http:/christianschwartz.com/) site (nor on [Paul Barnes'](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211654/http:/moderntypography.com/)), but I assume updates will be forthcoming. I also assume that although Porter only says "Guardian Egyptian," the entire suite (Sans, Text, Agate, etc.) will be available. But you know what they say about "to assume" ...
author: Reed Reibstein

comments.content: I assume the Dagbladet asked Christian for Guardian Egyptian directly, but I'll ask him for a confirmation.

I think Porter jumped the gun a little bit because he saw an early edition licensed to the Dagbladet. The Guardian family will be available from [Commercial Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211654/http:/www.commercialtype.com/) (Schwartz's and Barnes' foundry) sometime this year.

Finally, the Guardian family is available for licensing:  
 [Commercial Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211654/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/guardian) website is up and running!  
What a super website! Well done guys! :)
